00022 /* delay definition */
00023 #define GLCD_DLY_10US                        80     // 10us
00024 #define GLCD_RESET_DLY                       50     // 5ms
00025 #define GLCD_BOOSTER_ON_DLY                1200     // 120 ms

00027 static const GLCD_CmdCtrl_t GLCD_Cmd_Iss0[GLCD_CMD_NUMB] =
00028 {
00029 // (ISS=0)
00030 // NOP - No Operation
00031   {0x00, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00032 // SLPIN - Sleep in & booster off
00033   {0x10, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00034 // SLPOUT - Sleep out & booster on
00035   {0x11, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00036 // PTLOUT (NORON) - Partial off (Normal)
00037   {0x13, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00038 // INVOFF - Display inversion off (normal)
00039   {0x20, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00040 // INVON - Display inversion on
00041   {0x21, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00042 // DISPOFF - Display off
00043   {0x28, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00044 // DISPON - Display on
00045   {0x29, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00046 // CASET - Column address set
00047 // X_ADR start: 0h <= XS <= 83h
00048 // X_ADR end: 0h <= XS <= 83h
00049   {0x2A, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 2},
00050 // RASET - Row address set
00051 // Y_ADR start: 0h <= YS <= 83h
00052 // Y_ADR end: 0h <= YS <= 83h
00053   {0x2B, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 2},
00054 // RAMWR - Memory write
00055   {0x2C, GLCD_WRITE, 0, (uint32_t)-1},
00056 // RGBSET - Color set for 256 color display
00057   {0x2D, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 20},
00058 // VSCSAD - Scroll start address of RAM
00059 // SSA = 0, 1, 2, … , 131
00060   {0x37, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 1},
00061 // IDMOFF - Idle mode off
00062   {0x38, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00063 // IDMON - Idle mode on
00064   {0x39, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00065 // RDID1 - Interface pixel format
00066   {0xDA, GLCD_READ,  0, 1},
00067 // RDID2 - Interface pixel format
00068   {0xDB, GLCD_READ,  0, 1},
00069 // RDID3 - Interface pixel format
00070   {0xDC, GLCD_READ,  0, 1},
00071 // FRMSEL - External oscillator select
00072 // Frame frequency in Temp range A
00073 // Frame frequency in Temp range B
00074 // Frame frequency in Temp range C
00075 // Frame frequency in Temp range D
00076   {0xB4, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 4},
00077 // FRM8SEL - External oscillator select
00078 // Frame frequency in Temp range A
00079 // Frame frequency in Temp range B
00080 // Frame frequency in Temp range C
00081 // Frame frequency in Temp range D
00082   {0xB5, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 4},
00083 // TMPRNG - External oscillator select
00084 // Temp range A
00085 // Temp range B
00086 // Temp range C
00087 // Temp range D
00088   {0xB6, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 4},
00089 // TMPHIS - Temp range set
00090   {0xB8, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 1},
00091 // TMPREAD - Temperature read back
00092   {0xB7, GLCD_READ,  0, 1},
00093 // EPWRIN - EEPROM write start
00094   {0xD1, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00095 // EPWROUT - EEPROM write end
00096   {0xD0, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00097 // RDEV - Read internal contrast (EV_IN)
00098   {0xD4, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 1},
00099 // RDRR - Read internal resistor ratio (RR_IN)
00100   {0xD5, GLCD_READ,  0, 1},
00101 // Adapted commands
00102 // PTIN - adapted command (PTLAR + PTIN)
00103   {0x00, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00104 // SCRLAR - Scroll area set (2-line unit)
00105 // TFA = 0,1,2, … , 132
00106 // VSA = 0,1,2, … , 132
00107 // BFA = 0,1,2, … , 132
00108   {0x33, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 3},
00109 // DATCTR - adapted command (MADCTR + COLMOD)
00110   {0x00, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00111 // SETCON - Write contrast 0 - 127
00112   {0x25, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 1},
00113 // Commands applicable only when ISS=1
00114 // OSCON
00115   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00116 // OSCOFF
00117   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00118 // RMWIN
00119   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00120 // RMWOUT
00121   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00122 // VOLUP
00123   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00124 // VOLDOWN
00125   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00126 // ASCSET
00127   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00128 // DISCTR
00129   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00130 // PWRCTR
00131   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00132 // VOLCTR
00133   {GLCD_INV_CMD, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00134 // Commands applicable only when ISS=0
00135 // CLKINT - Internal oscillator select
00136   {0xB0, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00137 // CLKEXT - External oscillator select
00138   {0xB1, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00139 // RDDST - Read Display Status
00140   {0x09, GLCD_READ,  1, 4},
00141 // SWRESET - Software reset
00142   {0x01, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00143 // RDDID - Read Display ID
00144   {0x04, GLCD_READ,  1, 3},
00145 // PTLAR - Partial start/end address set
00146 // Start address (0,1,2, …, 131)
00147 // End address (0,1,2, …, 131)
00148   {0x30, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 2},
00149 // PTLON - Partial mode on
00150   {0x12, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00151 // MADCTR - Tearing effect mode set & on
00152   {0x36, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 1},
00153 // COLMOD - Interface pixel format
00154 // Interface format
00155   {0x3A, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 1},
00156 // APOFF - All pixel off (only for test purpose)
00157   {0x22, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00158 // APON - All pixel on (only for test purpose)
00159   {0x23, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00160 // BSTROFF - Booster off (only for test purpose)
00161   {0x02, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00162 // BSTRON - Booster on (only for test purpose)
00163   {0x03, GLCD_WRITE, 0, 0},
00164 };

00320 static GLCD_ISS_t Glcd_Iss;
00321 static Bool OddPixel = FALSE;
00322 static uint32_t PixelHold = 0;
00323

00325 static pFontType_t pCurrFont = NULL;
00326 static LdcPixel_t TextColour;
00327 static LdcPixel_t TextBackgndColour;

00339 /*************************************************************************
00340  * Function Name: GLCD_SendCmd
00341  * Parameters: GLCD_SendCmd Cmd, unsigned char *pData, uint32_t Size
00342  * Return: GLCD_Status_t
00343  *
00344  * Description: Send command to the Graphic LCD
00345  *
00346  *************************************************************************/
00347 GLCD_Status_t GLCD_SendCmd (GLCD_Cmd_t Cmd, unsigned char *pData, uint32_t Size)
00348 {
00349         static Bool Write2_DRAM = FALSE; // write to DRAM mode
00350         static uint32_t ResRatio;             // Hold resistor ratio init by VOLCTR
00351                                     // and used by SETCON adapted command
00352         pDATCTR_Data_t pDATCTR_Data;
00353         uint8_t ColourSch;
00354         pASCSET_Data_t pASCSET_Data;
00355         MADCTR_Data_t DataMode = {0};
00356         // Pointer to current set of commands
00357         pGLCD_CmdCtrl_t pGLCD_CmdCtrl = (pGLCD_CmdCtrl_t)(((Glcd_Iss==GLCD_ISS_0)?
00358                                                                         GLCD_Cmd_Iss0:GLCD_Cmd_Iss1) + Cmd);
00359 
00360         uint32_t Contrast;
00361 
00362         if(Write2_DRAM)
00363         {
00364                 // Select LCD
00365                 GLCD_SPI_ChipSelect(1);
00366                 if(Cmd != RAMWR)
00367                 {
00368                         Write2_DRAM = FALSE;
00369                         if(PixelHold & WAITED_PIXEL)
00370                         {
00371                                 // Flush pixel
00372                                 GLCD_SPI_TranserByte(PixelHold);
00373                         }
00374                         // Release CS
00375                         GLCD_SPI_ChipSelect(0);
00376                 }
00377                 else
00378                 {
00379                         // pixels collection
00380                         uint32_t Pixel;
00381                         while(Size > 1)
00382                         {
00383                                 Pixel  =  *pData++;
00384                                 Pixel |= (*pData++)<<8;
00385                                 PixelHold |= WAITED_PIXEL;
00386                                 if(!OddPixel)
00387                                 {
00388                                         // Get even pixel
00389                                         PixelHold |= PIXEL_CONV(Pixel,0);
00390                                 }
00391                                 else
00392                                 {
00393                                         // Apply odd pixel
00394                                         PixelHold |= PIXEL_CONV(Pixel,1);
00395                                         // and send together both pixels
00396                                         GLCD_SPI_SendBlock((unsigned char *)&PixelHold,3);
00397                                         PixelHold = 0;
00398                                 }
00399                                 // update the even/odd flag
00400                                 OddPixel ^= 1;
00401                                 // update the counter of the remaining bytes
00402                                 Size -= 2;
00403                         }
00404                         // Release CS
00405                         GLCD_SPI_ChipSelect(0);
00406                         return(GLCD_OK);
00407                 }
00408         }
00409 
00410         // sanitary check of command
00411         if(pGLCD_CmdCtrl->Cmd == GLCD_INV_CMD)
00412         {
00413                 return(GLCD_UNSUPPORTED);
00414         }
00415 
00416         // Implement adapted commands
00417         if(Glcd_Iss==GLCD_ISS_0)
00418         {
00419                 switch(Cmd)
00420                 {
00421                 case PTIN:
00422                         // PTLAR + PTIN
00423                         GLCD_SendCmd(PTLAR,pData,0);
00424                         GLCD_SendCmd(PTLON,NULL,0);
00425                         return(GLCD_OK);
00426                 case DATCTR:
00427                         pDATCTR_Data = (pDATCTR_Data_t)pData;
00428                                 // MADCTR + COLMOD
00429                                 // Data reconstruction
00430                         DataMode.MY = pDATCTR_Data->MY;
00431                         DataMode.MX = pDATCTR_Data->MX;
00432                         DataMode.MV = pDATCTR_Data->MV;
00433                         DataMode.ML = pDATCTR_Data->ML;
00434                         DataMode.RGB = !pDATCTR_Data->RGB;
00435                         GLCD_SendCmd(MADCTR,(unsigned char*)&DataMode,0);
00436                         // 4K colors Type A
00437                         ColourSch = 3;
00438                         return(GLCD_SendCmd(COLMOD,&ColourSch,0));
00439                 }
00440         }
00441         else
00442         {
00443                 switch(Cmd)
00444                 {
00445                 case SCRLAR:
00446                         pASCSET_Data = (pASCSET_Data_t)pData;
00447                         pASCSET_Data->Smd = 0;  // Center screen scroll mode
00448                         GLCD_SendCmd(ASCSET,pData,0);
00449                         return(GLCD_OK);
00450                 case DATCTR:
00451                         pDATCTR_Data = (pDATCTR_Data_t)pData;
00452                         pDATCTR_Data->ML  = 0;
00453                         pDATCTR_Data->MX = !pDATCTR_Data->MX;
00454                         // 4K colors Type A
00455                         pDATCTR_Data->GS  = 2;
00456                         break;
00457                 case SETCON:
00458                         Contrast = *pData | (ResRatio << 8);
00459                         return(GLCD_SendCmd(VOLCTR,(unsigned char *)&Contrast,0));
00460                 case VOLCTR:
00461                         ResRatio = *(pData+1);
00462                         break;
00463                         }
00464                 }
00465 
00466         if(pGLCD_CmdCtrl->Param != (uint32_t)-1)
00467         {
00468                 // Command with fixed size of parameters
00469                 Size = pGLCD_CmdCtrl->Param;
00470         }
00471 
00472         // Select LCD
00473         GLCD_SPI_ChipSelect(1);
00474 
00475         GLCD_SPI_TranserByte(pGLCD_CmdCtrl->Cmd);
00476         if(Cmd == RAMWR)
00477         {
00478                 // enter in write to DRAM mode
00479                 OddPixel = FALSE;
00480                 PixelHold = 0;
00481                 Write2_DRAM = TRUE;
00482                 return(GLCD_SendCmd(RAMWR,pData,Size));
00483         }
00484 
00485         // Send/Receive parameters
00486         if(pGLCD_CmdCtrl->Dir == GLCD_READ)
00487         {
00488                 if(pGLCD_CmdCtrl->Pulse)
00489                 {
00490                         if(Size)
00491                         {
00492                                 *pData++ = GLCD_SPI_TranserByte(0xFFFF);
00493                                 --Size;
00494                         }
00495                 }
00496                 GLCD_SPI_SetWordWidth(8);
00497         }
00498 
00499         if(pGLCD_CmdCtrl->Dir == GLCD_READ)
00500         {
00501                 GLCD_SPI_ReceiveBlock(pData,Size);
00502         }
00503         else
00504         {
00505                 GLCD_SPI_SendBlock(pData,Size);
00506         }
00507 
00508         // Release CS
00509         GLCD_SPI_ChipSelect(0);
00510         if(pGLCD_CmdCtrl->Dir == GLCD_READ)
00511         {
00512                 GLCD_SPI_SetWordWidth(9);
00513         }
00514         return(GLCD_OK);
00515 }
00516 
00517 /*************************************************************************
00518  * Function Name: GLCD_PowerUpInit
00519  * Parameters: unsigned char *pInitData
00520  * Return: GLCD_Status_t
00521  *         GLCD_OK - init pass
00522  *         GLCD_ID_ERROR - unsupported driver type
00523  * Description: Power-up initialization of Graphic LCD
00524  *
00525  *************************************************************************/
00526 //GLCD_Status_t GLCD_PowerUpInit (unsigned char *pInitData)
00527 GLCD_Status_t GLCD_PowerUpInit (unsigned char *pInitData)
00528 {
00529         uint32_t Data;
00530         volatile uint32_t i;
00531         pDATCTR_Data_t pDATCTR_Data;
00532         // Init SPI and IO
00533         // Init low level
00534         GLCD_SPI_Init(GLCD_DEF_CLOCK,GLCD_DEF_WIDTH);
00535         GLCD_LLInit();
00536 
00537         // H/W Reset
00538         // Rest L > 10us H
00539         GLCD_SetReset(0);
00540         for(i = GLCD_DLY_10US; i ; --i);
00541         GLCD_SetReset(1);
00542 
00543         // Wait 5 ms
00544         Dly100us((void *)GLCD_RESET_DLY);
00545         // Identify LCD and command interpreter
00546         Glcd_Iss = GLCD_ISS_0;
00547         GLCD_SendCmd(RDDID,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00548         if(((Data & 0xFF) != GLCD_MANF_ID) ||(((Data >> 16)& 0xFF) != GLCD_MOD_ID))
00549         {
00550                 // Iss = 1 don't support RDDID command
00551                 Glcd_Iss = GLCD_ISS_1;
00552         }
00553         // Power Supply Set
00554         if(Glcd_Iss == GLCD_ISS_1)
00555         {
00556                 // Support only 4K colors
00557                 assert(GLCD_DEF_DPL_ML == 0);
00558                 //  DISCTR (Display Control)
00559                 //       - F1/F2 switching period set
00560                 //       - Line inversion set
00561                 Data = 0 | (0x20UL << 8) | (0x11UL << 16);
00562                 GLCD_SendCmd(DISCTR,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00563                 //  OSCON (Oscillator ON)
00564                 GLCD_SendCmd(OSCON,NULL,0);
00565                 // Set contrast
00566                 Data = 0x20 | (0x0UL << 8);
00567                 GLCD_SendCmd(VOLCTR,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00568         }
00569         else
00570         {
00571                 // Set contrast
00572                 Data = 0x30;
00573                 GLCD_SendCmd(SETCON,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00574         }
00575         // SLPOUT (Sleep mode OFF & OSC/Booster On)
00576         GLCD_SendCmd(SLPOUT,NULL,0); // Sleep out
00577         if(Glcd_Iss == GLCD_ISS_0)
00578         {
00579                 GLCD_SendCmd(BSTRON,NULL,0); // Booster voltage on
00580         }
00581         // Display Environment Set
00582         // Display inversion setting
00583         GLCD_SendCmd(GLCD_DEF_DPL_INV?INVON:INVOFF,NULL,0);
00584         // Display color scheme setting
00585         GLCD_SendCmd(GLCD_DEF_DPL_8_COLOR?IDMON:IDMOFF,NULL,0);
00586         // Display partial setting
00587         if(GLCD_DEF_DPL_PARTIAL_MODE)
00588         {
00589                 GLCD_SendCmd(PTLOUT,NULL,0);
00590         }
00591         else
00592         {
00593 #if GLCD_DEF_DPL_PARTIAL_MODE > 0
00594 #error "PARTIAL_MODE not supported yet"
00595 #endif // GLCD_DEF_DPL_PARTIAL_MODE > 0
00596         }
00597         // Memory Data Access Control
00598         Data = 0;
00599         pDATCTR_Data = (pDATCTR_Data_t)&Data;
00600         pDATCTR_Data->RGB = GLCD_DEF_DPL_RGB_ORD;               // BGR / RGB order
00601         /* Because NXP_logo data was generated by reverse row direction so have to set MY = 1 */
00602         pDATCTR_Data->MY = 1;                                                   // no mirror Y
00603         pDATCTR_Data->MX = GLCD_DEF_DPL_MX;                     // no mirror X
00604         pDATCTR_Data->MV = GLCD_DEF_DPL_V;                              // vertical RAM write in Y/X direction
00605         pDATCTR_Data->ML = GLCD_DEF_DPL_ML;                     // line address order (bottom to top) / (top to bottom)
00606         // support only 4k type A colored scheme
00607         GLCD_SendCmd(DATCTR,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00608         // Display Data Write & Display On
00609         // COLUMN ADDRESS SET and PAGE ADDRESS SET
00610         Data = 0 | ((GLCD_HORIZONTAL_SIZE - 1)<<8);
00611         GLCD_SendCmd(RASET,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00612         GLCD_SendCmd(CASET,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00613 
00614         // Init display memory
00615         if(pInitData == NULL)
00616         {
00617                 Data = DEF_BACKGND_COLOUR;
00618                 for(i = 0; i < (GLCD_HORIZONTAL_SIZE * GLCD_VERTICAL_SIZE); ++i)
00619     {
00620                         LCD_WRITE_PIXEL(Data);
00621     }
00622                 LCD_FLUSH_PIXELS();
00623         }
00624         else
00625         {
00626                 GLCD_SendCmd(RAMWR,pInitData,GLCD_HORIZONTAL_SIZE * GLCD_VERTICAL_SIZE * 2);
00627         }
00628         if(Glcd_Iss == GLCD_ISS_1)
00629         {
00630                 // PWRCTR
00631                 Data = 0x1F;
00632                 GLCD_SendCmd(PWRCTR,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00633         }
00634         // Memory Data Access Control
00635         /* Reset default control mode after drawing */
00636         pDATCTR_Data = (pDATCTR_Data_t)&Data;
00637         pDATCTR_Data->RGB = GLCD_DEF_DPL_RGB_ORD;               // BGR / RGB order
00638         pDATCTR_Data->MY = GLCD_DEF_DPL_MY;                     // no mirror Y
00639         pDATCTR_Data->MX = GLCD_DEF_DPL_MX;                     // no mirror X
00640         pDATCTR_Data->MV = GLCD_DEF_DPL_V;                              // vertical RAM write in Y/X direction
00641         pDATCTR_Data->ML = GLCD_DEF_DPL_ML;                     // line address order (bottom to top) / (top to bottom)
00642         // support only 4k type A colored scheme
00643         GLCD_SendCmd(DATCTR,(unsigned char *)&Data,0);
00644 
00645         // Wait for more than 120ms after power control command
00646         Dly100us((void *)GLCD_BOOSTER_ON_DLY);
00647         GLCD_SendCmd(GLCD_DISPLAY_STATE?DISPON:DISPOFF,NULL,0);
00648         return(GLCD_OK);
00649 }
00650 
00651 /*************************************************************************
00652  * Function Name: GLCD_SetFont
00653  * Parameters: pFontType_t pFont, LdcPixel_t Color
00654  *              LdcPixel_t BackgndColor
00655  *
00656  * Return: none
00657  *
00658  * Description: Set current font, font color and background color
00659  *
00660  *************************************************************************/
00661 void GLCD_SetFont(pFontType_t pFont, LdcPixel_t Color, LdcPixel_t BackgndColor)
00662 {
00663         pCurrFont = pFont;
00664         TextColour = Color;
00665         TextBackgndColour = BackgndColor;
00666 }
00667 
00668 /*************************************************************************
00669  * Function Name: GLCD_SetWindow
00670  * Parameters: uint32_t X_Left, uint32_t Y_Up,
00671  *             uint32_t X_Right, uint32_t Y_Down
00672  *
00673  * Return: none
00674  *
00675  * Description: Set draw window XY coordinate in pixels
00676  *
00677  *************************************************************************/
00678 void GLCD_SetWindow(uint32_t X_Left, uint32_t Y_Up,
00679                     uint32_t X_Right, uint32_t Y_Down)
00680 {
00681         assert(X_Right < GLCD_HORIZONTAL_SIZE);
00682         assert(Y_Down < GLCD_VERTICAL_SIZE);
00683         assert(X_Left < X_Right);
00684         assert(Y_Up < Y_Down);
00685         XL_Win = X_Left;
00686         YU_Win = Y_Up;
00687         XR_Win = X_Right;
00688         YD_Win = Y_Down;
00689 }
00690 
00691 /*************************************************************************
00692  * Function Name: GLCD_TextSetPos
00693  * Parameters: uint32_t X_UpLeft, uint32_t Y_UpLeft,
00694  *             uint32_t X_DownLeft, uint32_t Y_DownLeft
00695  *
00696  * Return: none
00697  *
00698  * Description: Set text X,Y coordinate in characters
00699  *
00700  *************************************************************************/
00701 void GLCD_TextSetPos(uint32_t X, uint32_t Y)
00702 {
00703         TextX_Pos = X;
00704         TextY_Pos = Y;
00705 }
00706 
00707 /*************************************************************************
00708  * Function Name: GLCD_TextSetTabSize
00709  * Parameters: uint32_t Size
00710  *
00711  * Return: none
00712  *
00713  * Description: Set text tab size in characters
00714  *
00715  *************************************************************************/
00716 void GLCD_TextSetTabSize(uint32_t Size)
00717 {
00718         TabSize = Size;
00719 }
00720 
00721 /*************************************************************************
00722  * Function Name: GLCD_TextCalcWindow
00723  * Parameters: pInt32U pXL, pInt32U pXR,
00724  *             pInt32U pYU, pInt32U pYD,
00725  *             pInt32U pH_Size, pInt32U pV_Size
00726  *
00727  * Return: Bool
00728  *          FALSE - out of window coordinate aren't valid
00729  *          TRUE  - the returned coordinate are valid
00730  *
00731  * Description: Calculate character window
00732  *
00733  *************************************************************************/
00734 static Bool GLCD_TextCalcWindow (unsigned int *pXL, unsigned int *pXR,
00735                              unsigned int *pYU, unsigned int *pYD,
00736                              unsigned int *pH_Size, unsigned int *pV_Size)
00737 {
00738         *pH_Size = pCurrFont->H_Size;
00739         *pV_Size = pCurrFont->V_Size;
00740         *pXL = XL_Win + (TextX_Pos*pCurrFont->H_Size);
00741         if(*pXL > XR_Win)
00742         {
00743                 return(FALSE);
00744         }
00745         *pYU = YU_Win + (TextY_Pos*pCurrFont->V_Size);
00746         if(*pYU > YD_Win)
00747         {
00748                 return(FALSE);
00749         }
00750 
00751         *pXR   = XL_Win + ((TextX_Pos+1)*pCurrFont->H_Size) - 1;
00752         if(*pXR > XR_Win)
00753         {
00754                 *pH_Size -= *pXR - XR_Win;
00755                 *pXR = XR_Win;
00756         }
00757 
00758         *pYD = YU_Win + ((TextY_Pos+1)*pCurrFont->V_Size) - 1;
00759         if(*pYD > YD_Win)
00760         {
00761                 *pV_Size -= *pYD - YD_Win;
00762                 *pYD = YD_Win;
00763         }
00764 
00765         return(TRUE);
00766 }
00767 
00768 /*************************************************************************
00769  * Function Name: GLCD_putchar
00770  * Parameters: int c
00771  *
00772  * Return: none
00773  *
00774  * Description: Put char function
00775  *
00776  *************************************************************************/
00777 int GLCD_putchar (int c)
00778 {
00779         unsigned char *pSrc;
00780         uint32_t H_Line, i, j, k;
00781         uint32_t xl,xr,yu,yd,Temp,V_Size, H_Size, SrcInc = 1;
00782         uint32_t WhiteSpaceNumb;
00783         if(pCurrFont == NULL)
00784         {
00785                 return(-1);
00786         }
00787         H_Line = (pCurrFont->H_Size / 8) + ((pCurrFont->H_Size % 8)?1:0);
00788         switch(c)
00789         {
00790         case '\n':  // go to start of next line (NewLine)
00791                 ++TextY_Pos;
00792                 break;
00793         case '\r':  // go to start of this line (Carriage Return)
00794                 // clear from current position to end of line
00795                 while(GLCD_TextCalcWindow(&xl,&xr,&yu,&yd,&H_Size,&V_Size))
00796                 {
00797                         LCD_SET_WINDOW(xl,xr,yu,yd);
00798                         for(i = 0; i < V_Size; ++i)
00799                         {
00800                                 for(j = 0; j < H_Size; ++j)
00801                                 {
00802                                         LCD_WRITE_PIXEL(TextBackgndColour);
00803                                 }
00804                         }
00805                         ++TextX_Pos;
00806                 }
00807                 TextX_Pos = 0;
00808                 break;
00809         case '\b': // go back one position (BackSpace)
00810                 if(TextX_Pos)
00811                 {
00812                         --TextX_Pos;
00813                         // del current position
00814                         if(GLCD_TextCalcWindow(&xl,&xr,&yu,&yd,&H_Size,&V_Size))
00815                         {
00816                                 LCD_SET_WINDOW(xl,xr,yu,yd);
00817                                 for(i = 0; i < V_Size; ++i)
00818                                 {
00819                                         for(j = 0; j < H_Size; ++j)
00820                                         {
00821                                                 LCD_WRITE_PIXEL(TextBackgndColour);
00822                                         }
00823                                 }
00824                         }
00825                 }
00826                 break;
00827         case '\t':  // go to next Horizontal Tab stop
00828                 WhiteSpaceNumb = TabSize - (TextX_Pos%TabSize);
00829                 for(k = 0; k < WhiteSpaceNumb; ++k)
00830                 {
00831                         LCD_SET_WINDOW(xl,xr,yu,yd);
00832                         if(GLCD_TextCalcWindow(&xl,&xr,&yu,&yd,&H_Size,&V_Size))
00833                         {
00834                                 for(i = 0; i < V_Size; ++i)
00835                                 {
00836                                         for(j = 0; j < H_Size; ++j)
00837                                         {
00838                                                 LCD_WRITE_PIXEL(TextBackgndColour);
00839                                         }
00840                                 }
00841                                 ++TextX_Pos;
00842                         }
00843                         else
00844                         {
00845                                 break;
00846                         }
00847                 }
00848                 break;
00849         case '\f':  // go to top of page (Form Feed)
00850                 // clear entire window
00851                 H_Size = XR_Win - XL_Win;
00852                 V_Size = YD_Win - YU_Win;
00853                 // set character window X left, Y right
00854                 LCD_SET_WINDOW(XL_Win,XR_Win,YU_Win,YD_Win);
00855                 // Fill window with background font color
00856                 for(i = 0; i <= V_Size; ++i)
00857                 {
00858                         for(j = 0; j <= H_Size; ++j)
00859                         {
00860                                 LCD_WRITE_PIXEL(TextBackgndColour);
00861                         }
00862                 }
00863 
00864                 TextX_Pos = TextY_Pos = 0;
00865                 break;
00866         case '\a':  // signal an alert (BELl)
00867                 TEXT_BEL1_FUNC();
00868                 break;
00869         default:
00870                 // Calculate the current character base address from stream
00871                 // and the character position
00872                 if((c <  pCurrFont->CharacterOffset) && (c >= pCurrFont->CharactersNuber))
00873                 {
00874                         c = 0;
00875                 }
00876                 else
00877                 {
00878                         c -= pCurrFont->CharacterOffset;
00879                 }
00880                 pSrc = pCurrFont->pFontStream + (H_Line * pCurrFont->V_Size * c);
00881                 // Calculate character window and fit it in the text window
00882                 if(GLCD_TextCalcWindow(&xl,&xr,&yu,&yd,&H_Size,&V_Size))
00883                 {
00884                         // set character window X left, Y right
00885                         LCD_SET_WINDOW(xl,xr,yu,yd);
00886                         // Send char data
00887                         for(i = 0; i < V_Size; ++i)
00888                         {
00889                                 SrcInc = H_Line;
00890                                 for(j = 0; j < H_Size; ++j)
00891                                 {
00892                                         Temp = (*pSrc & (1UL << (j&0x7)))?TextColour:TextBackgndColour;
00893                                         LCD_WRITE_PIXEL(Temp);
00894                                         if((j&0x7) == 7)
00895                                         {
00896                                                 ++pSrc;
00897                                                 --SrcInc;
00898                                         }
00899                                 }
00900                                 // next line of character
00901                                 pSrc += SrcInc;
00902                         }
00903                 }
00904                 ++TextX_Pos;
00905         }
00906         LCD_FLUSH_PIXELS();
00907         return(c);
00908 }
00909 
00910 /*************************************************************************
00911  * Function Name: GLCD_print
00912  * Parameters: int c
00913  *
00914  * Return: none
00915  *
00916  * Description: Put char function
00917  *
00918  *************************************************************************/
00919 void GLCD_print (const char *fmt)
00920 {
00921         while(0 != *fmt)
00922         {
00923                 if(-1 == GLCD_putchar(*fmt++))
00924                 {
00925                         break;
00926                 }
00927         }
00928 }
Generated on Tue Jun 7 14:59:01 2011 for LPC1700CMSIS Standard Peripheral Firmware Library Manual by  1.5.9
